html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td b font span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p font b span
content: Is the packaging used for soft drinks recyclable?

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p font span
content: All packaging used by the soft drinks industry can be recycled and/or re-used to make other useful products. For example:

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li font span
content: aluminium cans are recycled and used with raw material to produce new batches of cans;

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li font span
content: plastic bottles can be used to make fleece textile products, fibre filling and street furniture;

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li font span
content: glass bottles can be reused or recycled to use in the production of new glass; and

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li font span
content: paper and board is recycled to produce tissue, paper bags, chip board, briefcases and office furniture.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p b font span
content: What do soft drinks companies do to reduce the amount of materials they use to contain their products?

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p font span
content: The soft drinks industry is at the forefront of packaging innovations and is constantly looking at ways to reduce the amount of raw materials used in various types of packaging. This process of "lightweighting" means that not only are fewer materials being used, but savings are also being made in terms of the energy required for the manufacture and distribution of products. Today, the average can uses 35% less aluminium than 10 years ago, with steel cans containing 50% less steel and average PET plastic bottles containing 25% less PET.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p b font span
content: What are the most popular types of packaging used to make soft drinks?

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p font span
content: The main forms of packaging used by the soft drinks industry are:

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li font span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li font span
content: plastic including PET (Polyethylene terephthalate), PVC (Polyvinyl chloride), HDPE (High density polyethylene), cups (made from polystyrene and polyethylene), pouches (low density polyethylene)

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li font span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li font span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p b font span
content: Drinks come in many different types of packaging. Why are certain products packaged in some forms and not others?

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p font span
content: When manufacturers are considering packaging for a soft drink they need to consider the functions of packaging to ensure that the products reach the consumer in the best possible condition. The functions of packaging are to contain, protect, identify and sell the product bearing in mind the impact upon the environment and the costs involved.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p font span
content: Certain packaging is more suitable for certain types of product than others when you consider the above criteria. A summary of the various attributes and disadvantages of the main forms of packaging when looking at their functions is detailed here in

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p font a span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p font span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p b font span
content: What have been the most important developments in terms of packaging for the soft drinks industry?

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p font span
content: There have been many varied developments in terms of packaging ranging from lightweighting of different packaging, to the introduction of new materials. For example the glass bottle is the traditional soft drinks container. Originally this was heavy and bottle shape was limited. Improvements in glass bottle design resulted in the introduction of the lightweight glass bottle.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p font span
content: Since then the industry has enjoyed the introduction of PVC and PET bottles, which enabled moulding of the bottles into various shapes, and the advent of the aseptic filled paper carton. In addition to this there has been the introduction of various closure systems to meet the needs of customers for the different forms of packaging.
